image.altText: Burma the elephant steps out of a large crate, as a zoo keeper stands either side of her

props.synopsis: Police escorts are not uncommon for dignitaries and heads of state — but a jumbo-sized new arrival in the form of an Asian elephant will be making its presence felt on some of Adelaide's main roads on Tuesday evening.

title.children: From jumbo jet to police escort, Burma the elephant makes the great trans-Tasman nomad

image.altText: Four people attend a vineyard

props.synopsis: Well-known Adelaide car salesman John Callisto had a lifelong passion for photography, with his images of Italy and Italian culture in Adelaide put on display in a posthumous exhibition that will soon travel to Melbourne.

title.children: Italian culture in Australia on display in posthumous exhibition for the late John Callisto

image.altText: A brown and yellow fly.

props.synopsis: Growers in South Australia's pest-free area are under enormous financial and mental stress as they battle Queensland fruit-fly outbreaks.

title.children: South Australian fruit growers fight to save their pest-free advantage

image.altText: Richard Boyle speaks to supporters outside court.

props.synopsis: Richard Boyle tells the SA District Court he plans to testify in his own defence when he stands trial next year accused of 24 offences which carry a maximum prison sentence of 46 years.

title.children: Tax office whistleblower Richard Boyle tells court he will take the stand to testify in his own defence during trial

image.altText: a driver behind the wheel at sunset

props.synopsis: An elderly woman loses an appeal to get her driver's licence back after failing two driving tests, including one where she amassed 182 penalty points — 160 more than a fail mark.

title.children: 97yo woman appeals licence suspension after amassing hundreds of penalty points in driving tests

image.altText: A footy oval next to a building and another oval still being worked on

props.synopsis: The fixture for next year's AFL Gather Round has been announced with two matches locked in at one of Australia's premier wine regions.

title.children: AFL Gather Round to take place in 'one of the most beautiful wine regions' in the world

image.altText: A man wears a suit and has short hair. He is superimposed on top of five colour supercars driving on a track.

props.synopsis: Supercars will be racing around Adelaide next weekend, but a different political race is underway in the southern suburbs. But how much of an impact has the state's former opposition leader had on this by-election?

title.children: What impact will outgoing Liberal leader David Speirs have on the by-election race?

image.altText: A photographer showing a sheep a photo that he took

props.synopsis: When spending thousands of dollars at auctions, potential buyers want great pictures to showcase their product. But how do you capture a ram or a bull's best side? That's where livestock photographers come in.

title.children: The art of getting the winning shot in livestock photography

image.altText: Bondi Junction Stabbing Rampage

props.synopsis: Joel Cauchi stabbed and killed six people at the Westfield shopping centre in Sydney's eastern suburbs in April before shot dead by a police officer.

title.children: Police had warnings about Bondi Junction killer's behaviour before mass stabbing, court told

image.altText: Barron Trump and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez in a split screen image.

props.synopsis: In the wash-up of the United States presidential election, it is becoming increasingly clear that it is impossible to divide American voters the way pollsters and strategists have in the past.

title.children: Barron Trump and AOC expose the problems with the Democratic campaign

image.altText: A woman holds a trophy aloft as people look on in Italy.

props.synopsis: When you hit the water from 20 metres up and are moving at 85 kilometres per hour there is no room for error. Rhiannan Iffland has turned doing it with dominance into an art form.

title.children: 'You need to be a daredevil': Australia's cliff diving world champion Rhiannan Iffland on what drives her

image.altText: Prime Minister wears glasses and suit standing outside for press conference.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says President-elect Trump described the relationship between Australia and the US as a "perfect friendship". Follow live.

title.children: PM says Trump called the US-Australian relationship a 'perfect friendship'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Dutton says latest foreign national arrival shows Australia is seen as 'weak'
📹: PM demands Dutton be upfront about election policies
Former Tas Labor leader Rebecca White confirmed as Lyons candidate

image.altText: Composite image of six victims of jumping castle tragedy with school signage as background

props.synopsis: An engineer tells a court the Tasmanian operator of a jumping castle at the centre of a 2021 tragedy was inconsistent and not competent to make the necessary safety assessments or deviations from the manufacturer's instructions.

title.children: Safety advice would have cost Hillcrest jumping castle operator around $2,000, court told

image.altText: Man in striped suit walking down steps

props.synopsis: Justice Gregory Geason will resign as a Tasmanian Supreme Court judge after being found guilty of assault and emotional abuse, and pleading guilty to breaching a family violence order.

title.children: Judge to quit Supreme Court as 'the destruction of his public image and professional life is total'

image.altText: A grainy, dark picture of two young girls smiling, wearing warm caps.

props.synopsis: The years-long hunt for the killer of two young girls in a small Indiana town may finally be over after a jury finds a local man guilty.

title.children: 'Today was the day': Almost eight years after Abby and Libby were murdered, a jury hands down a guilty verdict

image.altText: Shark bites a seal shaped decoy

props.synopsis: Researchers believe their work could mean a "revolution" in surfboard design that is potentially beneficial here in Australia.

title.children: LED lighting on surfboards may deter great white sharks from attacking surfers

image.altText: A man in a suit looks on, with chin resting on his hand. He is seen from close, with only his head, shoulders and hand visible

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's White House is continuing to take shape, with the US president-elect announcing hardliner Tom Homan will oversee his strict immigration blueprint, among other key appointments.

title.children: Donald Trump announces Stephen Miller, Mike Waltz as cabinet expands

image.altText: Cricket Australia CEO Nick Hockley, wearing a suit jacket, no tie, speaking at a press conference at the MCG during the day

props.synopsis: Nick Hockley has defended the decision to rest several Test stars for the series-deciding ODI against Pakistan, which Australia lost by eight wickets.

title.children: Cricket Australia CEO defends ODI selections after former captain says they 'didn't care about losing'

image.altText: An elderly couple down a mall with the help of a younger woman.

props.synopsis: An aging and geriatric medicine specialist says the project, led by researchers at the University of Queensland, shows people who maintain better health in their mid and later life are more likely to prevent dementia.

title.children: 'New hope' for dementia early intervention after study finds link between frailty and the disease

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman holding up a piece of fabric with artwork on it

props.synopsis: First Nations artist Jacinta Numina-Waugh speaks out after she was allegedly subject to unconscionable sales conduct by Optus that has landed the telco in court.

title.children: 'I feel really ripped off': Artist slams Optus after alleged unconscionable sales conduct

image.altText: An image of what appears to be aircraft debris.

props.synopsis: Firefighters at Sydney Airport have found small pieces of metal in long grass near the runway where a Qantas flight suffered an engine failure, triggering a grassfire.

title.children: Metal particles found in 'very unusual' discovery near runway after Qantas flight engine failure, grassfire

image.altText: Ice formations resembling tiny fern trees of snow poking out from the Antarctic ice sheet with the sun dominating the background

props.synopsis: Scientists behind a study of carbon dioxide within bubbles from Antarctic ice cores want policymakers to adopt an earlier baseline for global warming.

title.children: CO2 in bubbles locked away in Antarctic ice suggest Earth has almost reached 1.5C warming limit

image.altText: A man in a light-colured suit walks past a TV cameras operator.

props.synopsis: CCTV and police body-worn camera vision shows Clare Nowland using her walker to make her way to a doorway, stopping and raising the knife, before being tasered by Senior Constable Kristian White after several warnings at a Cooma aged care home.

title.children: 'You're going to get tased': Jury shown footage of police officer tasering 95yo holding knife

image.altText: Close up of Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin in conversation

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has reportedly called Russian President Vladimir Putin to discuss the war in Ukraine ahead of a meeting with United States President Joe Biden, but the Kremlin denies the two have spoken.

title.children: Kremlin says reports Trump spoke with Putin 'pure fiction'

image.altText: man wearing glasses and black suit mid shot with blue and white flags in background

props.synopsis: Hezbollah says it is not received any official proposal to end the conflict and it was prepared to wage a long war if needed.

title.children: Israel's foreign minister claims 'certain progress' in ending fight with Hezbollah, but militant group disagrees

image.altText: A  stadium with a large lit up sign that says COP29 in white writing.

props.synopsis: COP29 has kicked off in Baku, Azerbaijan, where countries at the summit have endorsed carbon credit quality standards to help fund projects that reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

title.children: Countries at COP29 give go-ahead to carbon credit quality standards

image.altText: a man in a black sweater leans against the front door of his house

props.synopsis: As the number of people facing a lifetime of renting soars, research reveals many Australian renters would pay more to secure long-term leases and homes that are above the minimum required standard.

title.children: Renters face 'a real social divide' as some say they would pay more for a 'forever' lease

image.altText: Uranus

props.synopsis: A fresh look at data on Uranus from 1986 has prompted NASA scientists to suggest the planet could support life.

title.children: Scientists' beliefs about Uranus proved wrong as data reassessed from a five-day fly-by in 1986

image.altText: a human-like female robot with a bob in front of a blotchy surreal portrait of a man

props.synopsis: "Can machines think?" Alan Turing's question revived by a robot's painting of the British scientist.

title.children: 'Can machines think?': Turing's question revived by a robot's painting of the British scientist

image.altText: A garage on fire at night on a suburban street in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Fire and Rescue NSW says there have been 81 e-scooter battery-related fires this year, more than two a week.

title.children: Three people hospitalised after suspected e-scooter battery sparks garage fire in Sydney’s south

image.altText: The Collingwood Football Club logo - a black magpie - on a sign.

props.synopsis: The club has denied claims by the former head of First Nations strategy Mark Cleaver that Collingwood breached discrimination laws.

title.children: Collingwood Football Club settles discrimination lawsuit with former Indigenous employee

image.altText: A boy lays in a hammock above dirty flood water. His feet hang in the water.

props.synopsis: Typhoon Toraji brought heavy rain and strong winds to the country's north-east, while locals begin recovery efforts from three other powerful storms in less than a month.

title.children: Thousands evacuated as Philippines hit by fourth typhoon in less than a month

image.altText: Satellite map of Australia with rain forecast for most states and storm warnings for many states.

props.synopsis: Senior Meteorologist Dean Narramore says every state or territory, with the exception of Tasmania, is going to see storms today.

title.children: Storm warnings across Australia as mainland prepares for rain
